results.title: Jim Post, Known for a Memorably ‘Groovy’ Hit Song, Dies at 82
results.abstract: He and his wife, Cathy Conn, had a Top 10 single with “Reach Out of the Darkness” as Friend & Lover in 1968. It’s still played today, but it was their only hit.

media.caption: Jim Post and his wife, Cathy Conn, better known as Friend & Lover, had only one Top 10 hit. But it remained a notable part of Mr. Post’s life for 54 years.

results.title: At Least 13 Killed in School Shooting in Russia, Including Children
results.abstract: An unidentified gunman entered a school in the city of Izhevsk, killing six adults and seven children, according to federal investigators.

media.caption: Police and paramedics working at the scene of a shooting at school No. 88 in Izhevsk, Russia, on Monday.

results.title: NASA Is About to Crash Into an Asteroid. Here’s How to Watch.

results.title: Kushner’s Company Reaches $3.25 Million Settlement in Maryland Lawsuit
results.abstract: The apartment company charged illegal fees and failed to adequately address leaks, mold and rodent infestations in its properties, the Maryland attorney general said.

media.caption: The company owned by Jared Kushner violated consumer protection laws by charging tenants illegal fees and failed to adequately maintain its properties, the 2019 lawsuit alleged.

results.title: Russia Begins Mobilizing Ukrainians to Fight Against Their Own Country

media.caption: A polling station in Mariupol, Ukraine, on Saturday, the second day of a referendum on joining the self-proclaimed Donetsk People's Republic to Russia.

results.title: LinkedIn Ran Social Experiments on 20 Million Users Over Five Years
results.abstract: A study that looked back at those tests found that relatively weak social connections were more helpful in finding jobs than stronger social ties.

media.caption: Researchers examined changes that LinkedIn had made to its “People You May Know” algorithm to test what sociologists call the “strength of weak ties.”

results.title: Russia’s Defense Ministry shakes up its leadership.

media.caption: Colonel-General Mikhail Y. Mizintsev was announced as Russia’s new deputy defense minister on Saturday.

results.title: Melatonin Isn’t a Sleeping Pill. Here’s How to Use It.
results.abstract: The “vampire hormone” can act like a dose of sunset, tricking your body into feeling like it’s time to sleep.

results.title: Democrats Swiftly Condemn Dixon for Mocking Whitmer Kidnapping Plot
results.abstract: A 2020 kidnapping plot against Gov. Gretchen Whitmer rattled Michigan. On Friday, her Republican opponent, Tudor Dixon, used it as a punchline in two campaign stops.

results.title: U.S. Warns Russia of ‘Catastrophic Consequences’ if It Uses Nuclear Weapons
results.abstract: The comments by the national security adviser, Jake Sullivan, illustrate how quickly the rhetoric has intensified as Russia has faltered on the battlefield in recent months.

media.caption: Jake Sullivan, the national security adviser, this month. American intelligence officials say they still believe the chances that nuclear weapons will be used in the conflict are low.
media.copyright: Gabriela Bhaskar for The New York Times

results.byline: By Ben Dooley and Hisako Ueno
results.title: Kyoto Wants You Back, but It Has Some Polite Suggestions
results.abstract: The city, one of Japan’s most-visited before the pandemic, desperately needs tourism’s money, but it would like to avoid the excesses of Instagram-driven itineraries.

media.caption: Before the pandemic, Kyoto’s Kiyomizu Temple was as famous for its congestion as for its sublime architecture and spectacular view of the city below.

results.title: Arizona Judge Reinstates Strict Abortion Ban From 1864
results.abstract: A 15-week abortion ban passed this year will take effect on Saturday. But the attorney general has argued that the near-total ban from the 19th century should take precedence.

media.caption: Attorney General Mark Brnovich of Arizona applauded the judge’s decision.

results.title: ‘They Have Nothing to Lose’: Why Young Iranians Are Rising Up Once Again
results.abstract: Amid growing repression, a sickly economy and bleak prospects, the death of one young woman was all it took.

results.title: Deadlier Than the Titanic: A Ferry Set Out With About 1,900 Aboard. Only 64 Survived.
results.abstract: Tourists, vendors, babies, hundreds of university students and a soccer team from Senegal perished in a little-known ferry disaster 20 years ago. Survivors and families of victims still want justice.

media.caption: The Kantene cemetery in Ziguinchor, Senegal, has 42 graves of victims of the wreck. Artists paid tribute to the deceased by painting on the walls this year.

results.title: Millennials Want to Retire at 50. How to Afford It Is Another Matter.
results.abstract: Dreams of stopping work, or doing only fulfilling work, 15 years before their parents did are colliding with the realities of amassing enough money to do so.
